      Service defineWorkFlowForService(java.lang.String creatorId, java.lang.Long serviceId, java.util.List<ServiceStep> steps)
      Access is checked Inputs are validated Order is calculated Existing workflow for service is flushed from DB New workflow is updated in DB Because this operation affects all the branches as they might have now different set of services they can offer based on counter-service step step mapping.

      • defineWorkFlowForService

        @Transactional(readOnly=false)
public Service defineWorkFlowForService(java.lang.String creatorId,
                                                                       java.lang.Long serviceId,
                                                                       java.util.List<ServiceStep> steps)
        Access is checked Inputs are validated Order is calculated Existing workflow for service is flushed from DB New workflow is updated in DB Because this operation affects all the branches as they might have now different set of services they can offer based on counter-service step step mapping. So entire JVM branch cache is flushed and refetched from DB.
        Specified by:
        defineWorkFlowForService in interface ServiceStepService
        Returns:
        updated Service instance
